text:
so here i am having my lovely saturday 
afternoon cup of coffee here in much wenlock

here are two words that are rather interesting 
but have very different meanings and uses

the words are sick and slurp sip 
and slurp the word sip is this
to drink something with care is to

sip it is seen as refined posh 
sophisticated and very classy

the other word is slurp slurp 
and this is what slurping is

so the next time you are having 
a cup of tea or a cup of coffee
or maybe something cold to drink
remember you must always sip and not slurp
